Dervish Moose Blog

  • Get to the BLOG

I am a Generalist technologist.

Turns out I am not really good at anything, but I know a fair amount about lots of stuff.
My day job is full of everything from hacking HTML, CSS, PHP, and Managing Web Servers
to Project Management, consulting and negotiating projects.

After hours I enjoy spending time with my family and looking for new tech things to learn about.

what I am grooving on right now

JavaScript Stuff

There are some really neat things going on in the JavaScript world right now. I'm playing with AWS Lambda and Angular. I am a latecomer to JavaScript, but I am getting there.

Ultra Light webhosting

My day job I work with Drupal . Drupal is great, but it is big and heavy. Jekyll, Hexo, JAWS (Serverless), S3 hosting are intresting counter points.

Ministry and Technology

For many years I have been exploring how I can use my love for and skills in technology for Ministry. Join me on the journey.

Latest from the BLOG

Can we salad bar Black Lives Matter

Photo: Fibonacci Blue Creative Commons When the organization I work for came out in support of parts of Black Lives Matter, my first thought was, “Wait you can do that? You can salad bar Black Lives Matter?” Can you take the parts you like and leave the things you don’t like in a movement? If you are a Christian, you already do that.

Serverless SlakBot, like PB & J

It’s like peanut butter and jelly. Good all by themselves, but way better together. Yum! Serverless (formerly JAWS) and Slack, BFF.

Ok you had me at Rambo Architecture…. but Rambo Architecture vs Chaos Monkey gotta read….

Photo jeffreyww via flickr It’s chili time again! With minor tweaks I won the crowd favorite in our office chili cook-off with this recipe.
